sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition:

x + y + z = 5

2x - y + 3z = 7

3x + 4y - 2z = 4
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to rewrite the system in the matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

The given system can be written as:

A = | 1  1  1 |      x = | x |      b = | 5 |
    | 2 -1  3 |          | y |          | 7 |
    | 3  4 -2 |          | z |          | 4 |

Now, we will perform QR decomposition on matrix A. QR decomposition is a method to decompose a given matrix A into an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R such that A = QR.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal matrix Q and upper triangular matrix R:

1. Find the orthonormal basis for A:

u1 = a1 = (1, 2, 3)
e1 = u1 / ||u1|| = (1/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 3/sqrt(14))

u2 = a2 - proj(a2, e1) = (1, -1, 4) - ((1, -1, 4)·e1)e1 = (-1/7, -10/7, 11/7)
e2 = u2 / ||u2|| = (-1/sqrt(42), -10/sqrt(42), 11/sqrt(42))

u3 = a3 - proj(a3, e1) - proj(a3, e2) = (1, 1, -2) - ((1, 1, -2)·e1)e1 - ((1, 1, -2)·e2)e2 = (1/3, 2/3, -2/3)
e3 = u3 / ||u3|| = (1/sqrt(6), 2/sqrt(6), -2/sqrt(6))

2. Form the orthogonal matrix Q and upper triangular matrix R:

Q = |  1/sqrt(14)  -1/sqrt(42)   1/sqrt(6) |
    |  2/sqrt(14) -10/sqrt(42)   2/sqrt(6) |
    |  3/sqrt(14)  11/sqrt(42)  -2/sqrt(6) |

R = | ||a1||  a2·e1  a3·e1 | = | sqrt(14)  3/sqrt(14)  1/sqrt(14) |
    |    0    ||u2||  a3·e2 |   |    0      sqrt(42)  -1/sqrt(42) |
    |    0      0    ||u3|| |   |    0         0       sqrt(6)    |

Now, we have A = QR, and we can solve the system Rx = Q^Tb:

Q^Tb = |  1/sqrt(14)   2/sqrt(14)   3/sqrt(14) | | 5 |
       | -1/sqrt(42) -10/sqrt(42)  11/sqrt(42) | | 7 |
       |  1/sqrt(6)    2/sqrt(6)   -2/sqrt(6)  | | 4 |

Q^Tb = | 26/sqrt(14) |
       |  9/sqrt(42) |
       | -1/sqrt(6)  |

Now, solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^Tb:

| sqrt(14)  3/sqrt(14)  1/sqrt(14) | | x |   | 26/sqrt(14) |
|    0      sqrt(42)  -1/sqrt(42) | | y | = |  9/sqrt(42) |
|    0         0       sqrt(6)    | | z |   | -1/sqrt(6)  |

From the last row, we get z = -1/sqrt(6) * sqrt(6) = -1.
Substituting z into the second row, we get y = (9/sqrt(42) + 1/sqrt(42)) / sqrt(42) = 10/sqrt(42) * sqrt(42) = 10.
Finally, substituting y and z into the first row, we get x = (26/sqrt(14) - 30/sqrt(14) + 1/sqrt(14)) / sqrt(14) = -3/sqrt(14) * sqrt(14) = -3.

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = -3, y = 10, and z = -1.
